Sentencas: This work investigates the reaction characteristics of the anode and cathode by overpotential analyses in 100 cm2 class planar anode-supported SOFCs.
Titulo: Electrode reaction properties using a reactant gas addition method in a commercial 100 cm2 class solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The reactant gas addition (RA) technique was applied to analyse the overpotential, which uses the reactant gas flow rate and partial pressure as parameters due to their variation upon adding a reactant species to an electrode.
Titulo: Electrode reaction properties using a reactant gas addition method in a commercial 100 cm2 class solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The anodic overpotential was determined to be made up of mass transfer-induced overpotentials of H2 and H2O species.
Titulo: Electrode reaction properties using a reactant gas addition method in a commercial 100 cm2 class solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The H2O species account for the majority of the anodic overpotential at the measured current range i.e., 0 -150 mA cm-2.
Titulo: Electrode reaction properties using a reactant gas addition method in a commercial 100 cm2 class solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Thus, the anodic reaction is under an extreme H2O-induced mass-transfer resistance compared with H2.
Titulo: Electrode reaction properties using a reactant gas addition method in a commercial 100 cm2 class solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The RA method showed that the cathodic overpotential was mainly due to a deficiency of O2 species in the mass transfer through the gas phase rather than the solid phase.
Titulo: Electrode reaction properties using a reactant gas addition method in a commercial 100 cm2 class solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Furthermore, both cathodic and anodic overpotentials depended on gas flow rate and utilisation, indicating a significant gas-phase mass transfer effect.
Titulo: Electrode reaction properties using a reactant gas addition method in a commercial 100 cm2 class solid oxide fuel cell
